glosses: In a way that one cannot untie and free oneself.

etymology: Inherited from Ottoman Turkish قیص قیوراق (ḳıs ḳıvraḳ), likely from قیصمق (ḳısmaḳ) and قاورامق (ḳavramaḳ), not from قیوراق (ḳıvraḳ, “lively, agile, sharp”), equivalent to kıs- (“to pinch, to squeeze”) + kavra- (“to grab, to seize”) + -k (adjectival participle suffix).
